document.docTitle: Heterotrissocladius flectus Kong & Wang, 2011, sp. n.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype male (BDN No. 14187 ), CHINA : Zhejiang Province, Tianmushan Natural Conversation area,
4 .viii. 1987
, sweep net, H. Zou. Paratype :
1 male
(BDN No. 21221 ), CHINA : Guizhou Province, Daozhen County, Dashahe Natural Conversation area,
25 .v. 2004
, light trap, H. Tang.
Diagnostic characters. The new species can be separated from other members of the genus by having a distinctly curved inferior volsella and bare veins except vein R.
Etymology. From Latin, flect – means bent, referring to the shape of the inferior volsella.
Total length 2.38–3.83 mm . Wing length 1.43–1.75 mm . Total length / wing length 1.67–2.19 . Wing length / length of profemur 2.30–2.69 .
Coloration. Head light brown. Antenna, legs and abdomen yellowish brown. Thorax dark brown.

Head . AR 0.78–0.90 . Temporal setae 10–11 , including 4–5 inner verticals, 2–3 outer verticals and 3–4 postorbitals. Clypeus with 17 setae. Tentorium 119–135 Μm long, 33–35 wide. Palpomere lengths (in Μm): 13 ; 31–40 ; 80–92 ; 80–101 ; 154–170 . Length ratio of palpomeres 5 th/ 3 rd 1.67–2.13 .

Wing (
Fig. 1
A). Anal lobe well developed. VR 1.22–1.26 . R with 11–14 setae, other veins bare. Wing membrane with sparse setae, m 1 + 2 with 3 , r 4 + 5 with c. 6 and cell an with 1–2 setae. Squama with 9–15 setae.

Legs. Spur of front tibia 31 m ; of mid tibia 17–22 Μm and 9 Μm long; of hind tibia 26–57 Μm and 13–18 Μm long. Tibial comb 25–40 Μm long. Width at apex of front tibia 26–31 Μm, of mid tibia 22–26 Μm, of hind tibia 22– 31 Μm. Lengths (in Μm) and proportions of legs in Table 1 .

tr.th: µm) and proportions of legs segments

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Heterotrissocladius flectus
sp. n.
: A. Wing; B. Hypopygium.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hypopygium (
Fig. 1
B). Anal point roughly triangular with pointed apex, 55–80 Μm long. Tergite IX with 17– 32 setae on the anal point. Laterosternite IX with 5–7 setae. Phallapodeme 40 Μm long; transverse sternapodeme 38–50 Μm long. Gonocoxite 170–210 Μm long. Inferior volsella distinctly curved apically, 25–45 Μm long, with 8– 10 setae. Gonostylus 78–80 Μm long, with triangular crista dorsalis. Megaseta 10–12 Μm long. HR 1.93–2.44 ; HV 3.60–4.83 .

Remarks. According to
Saether ( 1975 )
,
H. flectus
can be included into the
marcidus
species group. The new species is close to
H . hirtapex
Saether ( 1975 )
in the structure of its hypopygium, particularly in the shape of gonostylus, but
H . hirtapex
has a shorter anal point and a lower number of setae on the wing.
Distribution. The present new species were collected in subtropical mountain area in Oriental China (Zhejiang and Guizhou Provinces).

Material examined. Sichuan Province, Litang County, Zhaisang District, sweep net,
13 males
,
11 .vi. 1996
, X. Wang; Jilin Province, Changbaishan Natural Conversation Area, sweep net,
2 males
,
30 .iv. 1994
, X. Wang; Xizang Autonomous Region, Mt. Shergmla, Malaise trap,
1 male
,
28 .ix. 1997
, T. Solhøy & J. Skartveit.

Remarks.
Heterotrissocladius marcidus
was first recorded by Walker in 1856 as the genus
Metriocnemus
. Goetghebuer (1921 , 1934 ) and
Saether ( 1975 )
have described this species in detail.
